title: What happens if you go over 40 minutes on Zoom? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well then, it’s obvious. Everyone is automatically disconnected from the meeting. Duh. What Zoom probably doesn’t know (or does, but doesn’t care) is that the 40 minute time limit is rather useless. This is because everyone can just reconnect immediately. You’d think they would put a time limit or something before you can reconnect. However, I highly doubt they care anyway. They must be making so much money because of the pandemic. If it were me, I won’t care either. The only thing this 40 minute limit serves as is random interruptions. Kind of like Spotify: “To listen without interruptions, get Premium!” Does anyone know of anything which keeps bugging you to get Premium, asides from Zoom and Spotify? I’m putting a random image to throw you off:  Have you guessed it Yet? You’ve had long enough. Your answers are: 1. YouTube Seriously, are you gonna pay for YouTube premium? I thought as much.     2. WinRAR I have to end here. This answer has diverted so much from the main point.

First off, if you are connected with just 1 person you can be hooked up with them for an unlimited amount of time. Secondly if you hook up with more then 1 person then the 40 minute limitation kicks in. The last time (appx 6 weeks ago) I had 5 people on and a warning came on saying that the 40 minutes is up and because of the extenuating circumstance now they are not cutting you off at 40 minutes. It didn’t cut us off. I have since then purchased a Pro Version for a year. We have been using this in our business extensively the last few weeks.

if you are using the free version at 30 minutes a timer appears on screen and counts down until at 40 minutes it will disconnect the meeting, you can then start a new meeting but with a new code to re invite everyone, with the basic subscription ( about 18 Euros a month) your meeting can run for 24 hours if you wish, you can invite 100 people, i use the basic subscription which i think offers a great deal.

Zoom's free tier allows people to be in a meeting for up to 40 minutes.  Once 40 min timelimit has been reached, everyone will be kicked out of the call. This is probably the most frustrating thing about Zoom. If you want to increase meeting time you can use zoom subscription for that. Hope you find this useful Parth

If your account is a premium account, then you will be able to continue beyond 40 minutes. If your account is a free account, then you will be able to see a timer which automatically appears on the top informing the time left before the meeting automatically ends. After 40 minutes, the meeting automatically ends.

If the administrator (the person with the account that made the zoom meeting) has actually paid for that account (like a subscription of some sort), then it doesn’t really matter how long the meeting is, everything just continues. However, if that person only has the usual type of account (provided that that person makes the zoom meeting), the meeting is limited to 45 minutes. After that mark, the meeting will immediately get cut-off.

Till have, We’ve used the free version, and even after crossing the 40 minutes limit, it works without any problems. When there are more than 5 members, we got a warning message before 6 minutes to reach 40 minutes. Then it continued. So Its really great service.

Don’t know about other people, but for me whenever I use Zoom after 40 minutes is up me and the other parties in the Zoom chat are immediately kicked out I’m sure it’s the same for anyone else -The God of Quora

Over 40 minutes on zoom means you have consumed a lot of data. May be your eyes would get exhausted. On the lighter side, If you're married, wife will yell at you and if unmarried then either of the parents will get mad at you.

You can't go beyond 40 minutes in the free version . Call will get disconnected automatically. For unlimited time you need to buy their license or subscription and then you get some advance features and unlimited call time.
Regardless, no meeting should go on for more than 30 minutes, else it dissolves into either repetition or useless argument, neither are profitable….
